name: Philly Cheese One-Pot Pasta
description: A creamy, cheesy, budget-friendly, one-pot pasta dish of my own creation, with no need for heavy sour cream or cream cheese! You can fancy this up by using thinly sliced rib-eye or keep it budget with ground beef. Best of all, 30 minutes on the stove and you're done! I make this with Provel for that smoky/salty flavor, but if you're not a native St. Louisian and don't care for it, you can sub white American.
recipeIngredient: ½ cup finely diced green bell pepper
½ (8 ounce) package shredded Provel cheese
½ (8 ounce) package shredded pepper Jack cheese

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir ground beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard grease.

Stir thyme, garlic powder, salt, and pepper into the beef. Add bell pepper and cook over medium heat for 3 minutes. Stir in mushrooms and onion and continue cooking over medium heat until onions become translucent, 5 to 7 minutes. Pour in beef broth, milk, and pasta.

Cover and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and let simmer, stirring occasionally, until pasta has softened, 20 to 25 minutes. Add 1/2 the Provel cheese and 1/2 the pepper Jack cheese at a time, stirring after each addition, until cheeses are fully melted. Remove from heat; sauce will thicken slightly as it cools.

review.reviewBody:
This is worth keeping, but it needs some work.  Ingredients:  More, more, more onions & peppers.  I added a whole onion & pepper, strips; & still not nearly enough.  The mushrooms I used were an 8oz can.  I used some liquid from it rather than open another can of broth, which there was too much of anyway - liquid, that is.  I think you could reduce liquid by 1/4-1/2c - or you could add more pasta, 2 ounces, which isn't a bad idea because there is a lot of sauce.  I used a 7oz package roast beef, sandwich type, & that was more than plenty.  'Only a pinch of thyme as a little is enough for me. 
 Direction:  Sauteed onion till half way cooked, added pepper, mushrooms & spices for a few minutes.  Poured in liquids & pasta as directed.  Once heated, I added the roast beef cut into strips.  Covered & stirred occasionally.  Once pasta was cooked, gradually added the cheese - White American & Pepper-Jack.  E liked.
